org.apache.archiva.repository.storage

Interface StorageAsset

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FilesystemAsset

    public interface StorageAsset
    A instance of this interface represents information about a specific asset in a repository. The asset may be an real artifact, a directory, or a virtual asset. Each asset has a unique path relative to the repository. The implementation may read the data directly from the filesystem or underlying storage implementation.
    Author:
    Martin Stockhammer

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void create()
      Creates the asset in the underlying storage, if it does not exist.
      boolean exists()
      Returns true, if the asset exists.
      Path getFilePath()
      Returns the real path to the asset, if it exist.
      Instant getModificationTime()
      Returns the time of the last modification.
      String getName()
      Returns the name of the asset.
      StorageAsset getParent()
      Returns the parent of this asset.
      String getPath()
      Returns the complete path relative to the repository to the given asset.
      ReadableByteChannel getReadChannel()
      Returns a NIO representation of the data.
      InputStream getReadStream()
      Returns the input stream of the artifact content.
      long getSize()
      The size in bytes of the asset.
      RepositoryStorage getStorage()
      Returns the storage this asset belongs to.
      WritableByteChannel getWriteChannel(boolean replace)
      Returns a NIO representation of the asset where you can write the data.
      OutputStream getWriteStream(boolean replace)
      Returns an output stream where you can write data to the asset.
      boolean hasParent()
      Returns true, if there is a parent to this asset.
      boolean isContainer()
      Returns true, if this asset is a container type and contains further child assets.
      boolean isFileBased()
      Returns true, if the asset can return a file path for the given asset.
      List<StorageAsset> list()
      List the child assets.
      boolean replaceDataFromFile(Path newData)
      Replaces the content.
      StorageAsset resolve(String toPath)
      Returns the asset relative to the given path

    • Method Detail

      • getStorage

        RepositoryStorage getStorage()
        Returns the storage this asset belongs to.
        Returns:

      • getPath

        String getPath()
        Returns the complete path relative to the repository to the given asset.
        Returns:
        A path starting with '/' that uniquely identifies the asset in the repository.

      • getName

        String getName()
        Returns the name of the asset. It may be just the filename.
        Returns:

      • getModificationTime

        Instant getModificationTime()
        Returns the time of the last modification.
        Returns:

      • isContainer

        boolean isContainer()
        Returns true, if this asset is a container type and contains further child assets.
        Returns:

      • list

        List<StorageAsset> list()
        List the child assets.
        Returns:
        The list of children. If there are no children and if the asset is not a container, a empty list will be returned.

      • getSize

        long getSize()
        The size in bytes of the asset. If the asset does not have a size, -1 should be returned.
        Returns:
        The size if the asset has a size, otherwise -1

      • getReadStream

        InputStream getReadStream()
                   throws IOException
        Returns the input stream of the artifact content. It will throw a IOException, if the stream could not be created. Implementations should create a new stream instance for each invocation and make sure that the stream is proper closed after usage.
        Returns:
        The InputStream representing the content of the artifact.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getReadChannel

        ReadableByteChannel getReadChannel()
                            throws IOException
        Returns a NIO representation of the data.
        Returns:
        A channel to the asset data.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getWriteStream

        OutputStream getWriteStream(boolean replace)
                     throws IOException
        Returns an output stream where you can write data to the asset. The operation is not locked or synchronized. User of this method have to make sure, that the stream is proper closed after usage.
        Parameters:
        replace - If true, the original data will be replaced, otherwise the data will be appended.
        Returns:
        The OutputStream where the data can be written.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getWriteChannel

        WritableByteChannel getWriteChannel(boolean replace)
                             throws IOException
        Returns a NIO representation of the asset where you can write the data.
        Parameters:
        replace - True, if the content should be replaced by the data written to the stream.
        Returns:
        The Channel for writing the data.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • replaceDataFromFile

        boolean replaceDataFromFile(Path newData)
                     throws IOException
        Replaces the content. The implementation may do an atomic move operation, or keep a backup. If the operation fails, the implementation should try to restore the old data, if possible. The original file may be deleted, if the storage was successful.
        Parameters:
        newData - Replaces the data by the content of the given file.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • exists

        boolean exists()
        Returns true, if the asset exists.
        Returns:
        True, if the asset exists, otherwise false.

      • create

        void create()
     throws IOException
        Creates the asset in the underlying storage, if it does not exist.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getFilePath

        Path getFilePath()
          throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Returns the real path to the asset, if it exist. Not all implementations may implement this method. The method throws UnsupportedOperationException, if and only if isFileBased() returns false.
        Returns:
        The filesystem path to the asset.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - If the underlying storage is not file based.

      • isFileBased

        boolean isFileBased()
        Returns true, if the asset can return a file path for the given asset. If this is true, the getFilePath() will not throw a UnsupportedOperationException
        Returns:

      • hasParent

        boolean hasParent()
        Returns true, if there is a parent to this asset.
        Returns:

      • getParent

        StorageAsset getParent()
        Returns the parent of this asset.
        Returns:
        The asset, or null, if it does not exist.

      • resolve

        StorageAsset resolve(String toPath)
        Returns the asset relative to the given path
        Parameters:
        toPath -
        Returns:
